entry.title: Getting hands on

entry.title: Learning about helium leak detection
entry.summary: Hi all. Missed a week last week and my excuse is that I was in the lab pretty much every day + I had a big meeting with my project sponsor + I’m a bit slack. entry.title: Designing a model spacecraft
entry.summary: Hi all. As I’ve mentioned a few times on the blog I have been spending a lot of my time doing engineering design on a variety of small projects. I have recently started (as in this week) on a new one which is the design of a model to use in the wind tunnel, soContinue reading "Designing a model spacecraft"

entry.title: 6 things I’ve learnt about design
entry.summary: As an engineering student and even as an intern I didn’t do much engineering design. I did plenty of homework questions, assignments, and exam papers but I had never seen a project through from start to finish. For this reason I conceived of the design process as something abstract, linear, and all kept in aContinue reading "6 things I’ve learnt about design"View post to subscribe to site newsletter.

entry.title: What happens when you go really, really fast?

link.title: What happens when you go really, really fast?

entry.summary: Try to imagine what an aircraft that travels at 28,000 km/h might look like. One might imagine something long, pointy, and aerodynamic light a fighter jet or the Concorde and this would be perfectly sensible. However, we don’t have to imagine, we have a real life example in the Space Shuttle. The shuttle has aContinue reading "What happens when you go really, really fast?"

entry.title: Seminar presentation!
entry.summary: Hi all. Something a bit different this week – I decided to record a presentation I gave this week to my colleagues in the lab. It is a little bit technical and long but it’s a very detailed look at what exactly I’m doing day to day. Hope you enjoy!

entry.title: How aerospace engineers are fighting COVID

link.title: How aerospace engineers are fighting COVID

entry.summary: The answer: Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD). Firstly, computational fluid dynamics is a terrible, uninspiring name for something this is really quite accessible and very useful. Over the years, CFD has evolved from a primitive tool used in research laboratories to a ubiquitous, commercially available piece of software that is indispensible to engineers. Most recently, itContinue reading "How aerospace engineers are fighting COVID"
